intro: Pilogyne guamensis, commonly known as the Guam lily, is a flowering plant native to the island of Guam in the Mariana Islands. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has strap-like leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It plays an important role in the local ecosystem and is considered a symbol of Guam's unique biodiversity. Due to habitat loss, it is also listed as a vulnerable species.
